name: CH H
text:
After multiple visits to this Anthony's Cranston location, I had to post a good review to the Above Average warm service that I am always greeted by every time I visit! We mainly get "take-out" and have dined in a few other times on the outside patio or high tops and our food has always been perfect! Specifically "take-out" when the order is complete and not like other restaurants always seem to have some sauce, side item or such missing once you get home that makes ya nuts. We happen to love their margarita pizza, pot of meatballs, the smooth tasty sauce and Family sized salad- dressing is so simple and salad always fresh and crisp--Delicious!
But what really adds to me feeling great every time we leave is the warmth and upbeat service received, from the the time we enter, to just passing by the friendly bartender, then reaching the take-out stand in the rear, we normally have been acknowledged by 2-3 employees, that have just said a simple "hello with a smile" or offered assistance (even while their busy passing by) and the staff seem to really enjoy working together and working off of each other for help and I think it really comes down from the manager, Trisha H. She really sets a tone with a positive dining environment and is so pleasant, every and all interactions or assistance she provides us or when she assists a server taking our order. Trisha even helped when something wrong on our "rewards account" that another Anthony's location in Mass, had messed up repeatedly and seemed unable to correct, yet Trisha saw the issue in the system and fixed it w/out issue with a smile!
Kudos for the great customer service and exemplifying real hospitality service from one of your frequent visitors when over in Cranston! Thank you to your Team & keep up the good work! - Colleen

I ordered a small Pauly's pizza. Again the pizza was not very hot. All of the coal oven pizzas I've ever had are light and crisp with good char flavor from oven, and always very hot. Anyway service was fine no complaints on the staff at all.

One and Done for me.

text:
I had 2 bad experience with coal fired pizza places. But this place was amazing.
Excellent service with very friendly staff.
Prices are decent.
Had Philly cheesesteak pizza which was really delicious, the main issues with meat pizzas is meat fatty taste and stick that comes with it. But not this one, I beleive they used good quality leab meat, with good spices.
We also had egg plant one, was not happy as it only had tiny amount of cheese on top, and when we told the server he got us a new one with extra cheese that was really tasty.
As for the crust, it was great, crispy, thin and had the perfect amount of black charred edges.
I am usually a big fan of Chicago style deep dish pizza but this place made me love thin coal fired pizza style.
